title: We need a new map of Valoran and Runeterra in general.
body:
Title. With the rise of the universe page, I can't help but wonder how each nation is located in relation to each other. 

The two maps I found are either outdated or limited in scope, showing Piltover and Zaun as two very separate locations along with the location of the institute of war, and other being a zoomed in trade map of the Medarda Heirloom with Piltover as its center.

Both of these two maps are not enough. If Noxus and Demacia went to war, I want to be able to reference the map and know where their troops are located and when as well as have a decent grasp on the territories under each of their control. If a champion says they are in one location, I want to know where they will possibly turn up next or where they will pass through to get to their next location. 

It seems like a map would be like a focal point in delivering us the lore, and I'm frankly surprised we don't have a accurate map yet.

replies.body:
Well, even though it's only for trade, that Piltover map still tells us a lot. We see Piltover/Zaun (can we please start calling them the Twin Cities?), Bilgewater, the corner of Ionia, and Noxus. We also have directional arrows for Demacia (west along the coast) and Freljord. The Freljord arrow also points west, and since we know it's cold, it probably means that the western coast turns northward somewhere off the edge of the map. We also know from the Demacian lore that Freljord raiders are an issue for them. And we know from the Black Mists that the Shadow Isles are somewhere out beyond Bilgewater. 

Pay attention as well to those red icons over many of the cities. Most of them are the red ax of Noxus, which likely indicates Noxus influence or control of the settlement. The fact that they seem added - and in some cases along the southern coast of the middle sea, replacing the Shuriman icon - seems to indicate relatively recent expansions of Noxian influence to these locations. IIRC from one of Taliyah's stories, her return from Ionia to Shurima passed via Freljord. If the Noxians are in control of Shurima's ports along the middle sea, it makes sense that she would need to take the long way around the northern continent to access Shurima from the west. 

Those sailing times are also telling. A few minutes of researching historic sailing speeds shows that this narrow sea is comparable to the Mediterranean Sea IRL - maybe a bit larger. 

Overall, the geography of Runeterra is looking very similar to our Old World. We have a long east-west sea (Mediterranean). The continent to the south has a lot of desert (North African coast with the Sahara further inland), while the continent to the north is dominated a major empire*, Noxus (compare to Rome or a more united Christendom). We have a major trade hub on the east-west sea that is using its income from trade to push technological innovation (compare to Renaissance Italy). We have a mythical land to the east with ninjas and samurai (western perceptions of Asia). We see several cities that started out under Shuriman influence now under Noxian influence (comparable to the Crusades). 

*From what we've seen of the new Demacian lore, I get the impression that Noxus and Demacia are not equals the way they were implied in the old lore. I get the sense that Noxus is a major empire and Demacia is more of a protected enclave that is so far from Noxus, the Noxians haven't bothered to devote the forces necessary to subduing it . I get the sense that Noxus = Roman empire or Catholic Europe while Demacia = Britain, even if it doesn't end up being an island; we know they suffer from Freljord raids, as the English did from the Vikings.

I admire your deductive skills.

Have you looked at the Harrowing Map for confirmation of your Shadow Isles positioning?

http://imgur.com/s8AvwWp

> Piltover/Zaun (can we please start calling them the Twin Cities?)

I dunno, I'm kinda partial to a solution more akin to the combination of Buda and Pest into Budapest.

"Piltoverzaun", all one word, one uninterrupted flow of sound.

Alternatively, can we at least get something more colorful that "Twin Cities"? Something like The Cities of Science, or similar.
This could be a post in itself lol, good read.
Things are in the works! Though a full scale world map is unlikely in the near future. Or even in the sort of foreseeable future. Gotta make that stuff work narratively.

So Ezreal doesn't have the goal to travel the world, mapping out everything?

Btw, any reason why the "Shuriman continent" doesn't have an official name?

Well mapping is just one of the things he does, but he's no real cartographer. 

Not a clue as to the reason why, but I recon it comes down to Riot wanting to be 100% certain that this continent's name is the best it can be considering continents are a pretty big deal and if the name doesn't sound great or localisation comes back and says "Yeah this translates to &!?%$ so we can't use this", then you've gotta go back to the drawing board. That's why champions aren't named until way later in development. Dozens and dozens of names get pitched before they have a proper one, while being reffered to by a code name for the majority of their early development. Xayah and Rakan were known internally as Duo for a long time. Aurelion Sol was just Dragon.

We've been waiting for a proper name since it was revealed that Shurima was obviously not the capital of a continent also called Shurima. That was waay back with Azir's Q&A. But i figured Narrative scrapped giving it a unique name since canon lore references the southern continent as "Shurima" still. Most recently with Rengar's LU.
Id like to see if they ever add more landmasses.  Either an island(most likely)  or another full fledged continent.  I have the old map of valoran as my wallpaper.

Good point. In the lore, Zaun is an underground city, below Piltover, but in the map, they are two separated cities. Also, the geographic of the map is not appropriate: Demacia and Noxus are tropical regions, they still have temperate species. Ionia is in very north of Runeterra, even farther than Freljord, but Frelj is still colder and permanently frozen, just say, Ionia is in very north but have a tropical climate, too. Plague jg is in the very south of Runeterra, regularly, this pos must have a temperate climate, but the lore says that it is tropical. Blue Flame island, in which has Bilgewater city, is in the south, and it's climate seems to be hot and rainy. This is opposite to natural rules, even if Runeterra is a land of magic.
